messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Help! Allergies
messages.msgSnippet: Julie: I don t have any specific help for identifying the cause of the reaction, other than what s been already suggested by others. But I do have a great
messages.messageBody:
Julie:
I don't have any specific help for identifying the cause of the reaction,
other than what's been already suggested by others. But I do have a great
salve idea to soothe his bottom. This was suggested to me by a pediatrician
when ds was little and had reactions to medications. Mix zinc oxide powder
with liquid Maalox until it makes a paste and apply to the skin. There is
something about the neutralizing effect of the Maalox that works well. You
can get the zinc oxide powder from a pharmacy; you usually have to ask for
a small container of it from the pharmacist.

Good luck,
Olivia





> Date: Tue, 5 Sep 2000 15:57:25 EDT
> From: Jaam1224@...
>Subject: Re: Re: HELP! ALLERGIES
>
>hi all,
>
>I am desperate here! My 1yr old is having a reaction to
>something............big red baboon butt....anyone know what I can do to
>reverse the reaction....he is miserable.....I have tried a bath (he just
>screams). He has beem diaperless all day, but still not better. I have
>given him Tylenol for the pain but I was wondering if there was something
>else to try....anyone with allergy hints....
>
>I thought it came from my eating spagetti sauce last night, (still nursing)
>but now I am wondering if it is not something else in addition to that.
>
>HELP, ANYONE!
>
>Julie-putting on her detective and research hat
